intro: Astragalus transnominatus, commonly known as the Transnominous milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It plays a role in soil stabilization and is sometimes used in traditional medicine. Its scientific study contributes to understanding plant biodiversity in high-altitude ecosystems.
